definition: lit. heaven's law and earth's principle (idiom); fig. right and proper/right and unalterable/a matter of course
day/sky/heaven
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: We have been naive to think that it is perfectly justified.
sentences.chinese: 我们曾经天真的以为这是天经地义的。

sentences.english: Life is a deadly struggle in which only the fittest survive.
sentences.chinese: 高松年研究生物学，知道“适者生存”是天经地义。

sentences.english: Equality between men and women is fully justified.
sentences.chinese: 男女平等实属天经地义。

sentences.english: As a student of biology, Kao knew that "the survival of the fittest" was ordained by nature.
sentences.chinese: 高松年研究生物学，知道“适者生存”是天经地义。

definition: absolutely fair and reasonable (idiom); equitable
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
irreproachable (idiom)/nothing blameworthy about it at all
vocation/duty/mission in life
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side/to have the courage of one's convictions/just and forceful
human nature (idiom)/a behavior that is only natural
to both be willing/mutual consent
to have a clear conscience/to have no qualms about sth
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
to fulfill one's duty/to work without asking for reward
to pay
to break the law
to charge/to demand payment
reasonable and fair (idiom)
duty/obligation/CL:項|项[xiang4]/volunteer (work etc)
